page.title: 18GROVE VILLAGER'S ATTITUDES.
page.content: The chief topic of local village interest centres on the Church.While accepting that a village the size of Grove is too small to support its own vicar,the villagers generally believe that a 'shared vicar',with genuine interest in the village,could over the years have maintained regular Services and provided leadership for united village events.With the current'quota'still to be raised and general repair and maintainance work overdue,it is regretfully generally accepted that the Church faces closure.Only the one warden in office and te eight or so regular participants in the twice monthly Services appear to work seriosly for the cause.Memories of the older villagers are stimulated by the converted two schools,blacksmith's cottage and kennels.
